thread.title: Vikings pounce early, hand Patriots first loss of campaign
thread.title_full: Vikings pounce early, hand Patriots first loss of campaign

author: news@courierpublicationsllc.com (Staff)
title: Vikings pounce early, hand Patriots first loss of campaign
text:
Vikings pounce early, hand Patriots first loss of campaign By Staff | Oct 02, 2015 
Searsport â€” The Searsport boys soccer team has been sitting pretty near the top of the Class D South standings for much of the season. 
Even more so now after the team squared off with unbeaten Bangor Christian Thursday, Oct. 1 in Searsport. 
The Vikings scored the first two goals of the game and held off a furious second-half comeback by the Patriots (7-1) to pick up the 2-1 win, handing the visitors their first loss of the campaign. 
Connor Kneeland had a goal and an assist in the win while Liam MacMillan also creased the net, while Tyler Welch also scored for Bangor Christian. 
Ben Powell made 10 saves on 20 shots for the Vikings, while Austin Keib made three saves on seven shots for the Patriots. 
MacMillian got the scoring started 14 minutes into the game when he bet Keib on a perfectly-placed shot off an assist from Kneeland, who later added to the Vikings score when he converted a penalty kick with nine minutes left in the half after being dumped in the box. 
Welch later converted a penalty kick of his own to cut the Patriots' deficit in half, but the Vikings were able to settle down and maintain control of the game and earn their sixth win. 
In the Maine Principals' Association Heal Point Standings for Class D South, Searsport (6-2-1, 40.8418 points) is second, while Buckfield (7-1, 45.4214 points) is first in the 14-team region. The top 10 teams qualify for the playoffs.
